name: Erin's Jalapeno Hummus
author: Erin
summary: A smooth hummus with a kick, great for a healthy snack and quick and easy to make. The dried jalapeno can be found in your local grocery store and looks like dried parsley. Add sun-dried tomatoes or roasted red pepper if you want to change up the flavor, but this is completely optional. Garnish with a sprig of parsley and serve with pita bread or as a dip for veggies!
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained with liquid reserved
3 tablespoons olive oil, or more if needed
2 teaspoons ground dried jalapeno pepper, or to taste
½ teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
directions: Blend chickpeas, about half the reserved liquid from the chickpeas, olive oil, lemon juice, sesame seeds, ground dried jalapeno pepper, garlic, sesame oil, sea salt, and cumin in a blender until smooth and creamy
Blend more reserved liquid or olive oil into the mixture until the hummus reaches your desired consistency
